intro: Dumasia villosa f. lutea, commonly known as the yellow-haired dumasia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, yellowish pubescence. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically orange to yellow in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in specialty gardens and greenhouses.
